text: We are flying above the moors of northern Scotland follow the rugged, rolling terrain at bird-height.

Our shining BLACK WINGS rise and fall lazily as we ride t strong air currents. We drop down a steep stole and level out to skim the blue water of an expansive loch below. We wing our way above farmlands beyond. ee oe
We pass above a FARM WOMAN below. She pours MILK from a j onto a large STONE.
For the Fair Folk. We approach another farm house.

Two collies lay outside the house. They leap up as the SHEPHERD comes out with his YOUNG SON and WIFE. The Sheph and his boy walk toward the paddock. But they stop, disma to see that the paddock gate is wide open. The sheep are scattered across the wide field.

The Pixies have been at it again! He WHISTLES. The dogs race across the field to round up t sheep. The boy runs to help. His wife goes back inside an returns with a heavy iron pan. She mutters an old adage a she positions the pan above the door. SHEPHERDвЂ™S WIFE "Iron pot above the door. Protect our home from dark ones of the moor."
They herd the sheep down the road. Ahead, it crosses a thin line of DARK GRASS which runs through the lighter grass of the field.
Hold up! He takes off one of his work GLOVES and tosses it onto th road in the spot where it meets the line of dark grass.

Drop a glove before you cross a faerie path. They donвЂ™t like it if we donвЂ™t show respect. He whistles to the dogs. They nip at the sheep who trample the GLOVE as they run. boy picks it up and runs to catch up.
WE TURN and follow the FAERIE PATH which leads into wilde MOORS with peat bogs, heath meadows, thin forests, stream and misty mountains in the distance.

WE alight on the branch of a Blackthorn tree and TRAVEL d to reveal that WE are not a winged bird... ...but a WINGED GIRL. MALEFICENT is lean, all angles, with high cheekbones, a sharp chin and pointed ears. She looks about 15. She struggles with her LARGE WINGS like wild, unruly hair bef she gets them to fold behind her. ON THE MOORLANDS - MALEFICENTвЂ™S POV The natural sounds of the MOORS drift up to her. The soun gradually become discernible as VOICES: talking, laughing complaining, threatening, whining.
She takes a few BLACK NUTS from the tree and CRUNCHES the shell and all. GUTTERAL GRUNTING sounds from below draw h gaze.
MUD-COVERED CREATURES with round bodies and spindly arms legs move about in the bog. As they grunt and slobber, mu drips from their mouths which sustains and thickens the b

Several WINGLESS, WIZENED BALD ELVISH MEN burst from the branches, slapping her hands away from their nuts. * She makes an ugly face back at them. She grabs more nuts flies off following a ROCKY STREAM.

Maleficent lands on the bank and sits on a rock to finish her stolen black nuts. Pretty, female WATER FAERIES admire their reflections. Th LONG GREEN HAIR is made of silky trailing weeds. Nearby, shy, timid MOSS PEOPLE with large eyes lurk in th dark wood foliage. As they run their hands over the dried dead moss, it turns GREEN once again. *

A LONG GREEN ARM emerges from the water and reaches out toward MaleficentвЂ™s bare ankle. She looks down just as GREEN HAND grabs her ankle and jerks her off the rock. A MALEVOLENT WATER WOMAN, with knotted weeds and pebbles fo hair, pulls her toward the pond.
Let go! Maleficent kicks her away and flies off. The GREEN WOMAN slips back into the water. Maleficent fli toward a copse of tall trees ahead.
She lights in the branches of a tree to eat her black nut in peace. Loud, giggling LAUGHTER draws her attention.

Three FLOWER PIXIES play hide-and-seek in the meadow. KNOTGRASS, THISTLEWIT and FLITTLE are small, lithe, fligh girls with pointed ears, noses and tiny transparent wings FLITTLE wears all blue. SheвЂ™s plagued with ever-present butterflies that fly around her head. THISTLEWIT has a tiny round head with tufts of wispy hair that splay outward around her face like a dandelion. KNOTGRASS wears green and brown.  10 11 Her short dark hair sticks upright or falls down into her eyes. Color flows from the Pixies fingertips making the petals brighter, the grass greener or sagging flowers revive. They hear BELLS in the sky and rise into the air.
The Pixies fly past Maleficent in the tree.
The King and Queen are coming! They flit away. Maleficent rolls her eyes.
Gnats.
The sky is crowded with winged faeries. The beautiful QUE ULLA and her husband, KING KINLOCH lead the procession wh is lit by the wavering lights of WILL OвЂ™ THE WISP.

Below, wingless FAERIES emerge: Small ELVISH MEN with fee of crows and tiny eyes. Creatures with the bodies of smal HORSES and the heads of HUMANS. Web-footed SPRITES with h sharp teeth and pointed ears. WILD ELVISH WOMEN lurking a the base of Trees. EXT. THE FAERIE FLIGHT - EVENING a1 Maleficent flies up to join the procession. She soars up a higher altitude above the Royals. Queen Ulla glares up at her. The PIXIES fly up beneath Maleficent.
Come down!
YouвЂ™re not allowed to fly above the Queen! This only makes Maleficent fly even higher.  12

She soars high up, bursting through the clouds. Then she folds her wings and plummets straight down again through the crowded procession. Faeries flutter out of he way. She falls almost to the ground before her wings open and she soars up again. King Kinloch and Queen Ulla are not pleased.
We have to do something about her.

The procession approaches a large grassy HILLOCK. The King and Queen land on the mound followed by the othe The Faeries are all the size of SMALL HUMANS with delicat pointed ears and tiny refined features. Ulla steps onto A LOW FLAT STONE which leads to her thron like a stepping stone. As she steps up on it, the STONE, emits a CONTENTED PURR. The King sits on his throne next to hers. A back-wind stirs the air briskly as Maleficent lands on mound among the faeries. She stands head and shoulders ab them. Her WINGS loom above her head. She seems like a lar untamed BAT among finches.
Fold your wings. The Faeries fold their tiny wings. Maleficent has trouble getting hers to obey. The three Pixies smirk and giggle.
Maleficent!
Yes, your majesty.
Step forward. Maleficent tries to take a step, but one wing is caught under the foot of another faerie. She tugs it out and ste forward. She hunches uncomfortably as all eyes turn on he
No one flies above me.
Yes, your majesty. Knotgrass whispers to the other Pixies.
ItвЂ™s those wings. She canвЂ™t control them. One of MaleficentвЂ™s wings lashes out and knocks Flittle down.
Maleficent! She grabs it and pulls it in closely.
Control your wings. Or you will be punished. Step back, Maleficent. Maleficent steps back. The others give her a wide berth.
The King and I have just returned from a visit with the human King Henry. Like all humans, heвЂ™s easily impressed.
All we had to do was show him a little magic, and he showered us with gifts. Serving faeries fly in with trays of human-made cakes, mi wine, etc. The faeries partake eagerly.
ItвЂ™s the beginning of a beautiful friendship. Ulla frowns to see a WINGLESS BOY about MaleficentвЂ™s ag the crowd.
What is he doing here? Kinloch is embarrassed to see him. STEFAN is the illegitimate son of King Kinloch and a human woman.
IвЂ™m sorry, my love. (to the Boy) Leave the QueenвЂ™s circle, boy. The boy doesnвЂ™t move.
No, sir.
Leave the circle!
I have a right to be here.
You have no rights at all, halfling. You have no magic. You have no wings...
But heвЂ™s the KingвЂ™s son. Ulla gasps. The faeries go silent. Kinloch chokes out the words.
I...have no sons.
You donвЂ™t have to pretend. ItвЂ™s no secret. Everyone knows that...
Maleficent! UllaвЂ™s mortified at the public humiliation. She fixes Maleficent in a smoldering furious glare. The three Pixie draw away to be out of the line of fire.
Ever since that tragic night that you were born, I have tried to find the good in you. I have tried for my sisterвЂ™s sake. She breaks down briefly. The King touches her hand.

But I have failed because there is no good in you. YouвЂ™re a devilish thing! You were born that way.  13 She abruptly waves her hand at Maleficent. SheвЂ™s STRUCK VIOLENT MAGIC which knocks her to her knees.

You will wear these for a hundred years so all can see your true nature. The magic dissipates to reveal a pair of large black HORN embedded in the top of MaleficentвЂ™s head. The faeries d back in shock. Maleficent slowly reaches up to feel them. Horror crosses her face.

No! She tries to pull them off. The faeries shock gives way t smiles and smirks. Maleficent pulls and strains. But the horns are firmly embedded. The Pixies laugh. Flittle laughs so hard, she sucks in one of her ever-pres butterflies and chokes. Maleficent locks eyes with Stefan briefly. He looks horrified and guilty.

Maleficent walks through a shaded grove. Her head is bowed from the weight of the horns. She approaches a pond with WATER FAERIES. Frightened by the sight of her, they dive quickly into th water. She continues on. Two small HUMAN-HEADED HORSES ru off when they see her coming. She shrugs it off and continues on. Stefan appears out of the shadows.
Maleficent ? She abruptly turns and goes the other way. He runs around stand in front of her.
Go away.
I want to talk to you.
I donвЂ™t want to talk to you! One of her wings lashes out and knocks him to the ground. looks up at her.
I just wanted to thank you for standing up for me.
A lot of good it did me! She sits down on a rock. He gets up and sits next to her.
IвЂ™m sorry about the... He indicates the horns.
Queen Ulla is a tyrant.
I know... They sit in silence for a moment.
I like your wings.
You do?
I wish I had some.
I donвЂ™t blame you. She holds a wing out for him to touch. He hesitates.
They donвЂ™t bite. He strokes the soft feathers.  14 10.

The Pixies gambol in the meadow. Bees and hummingbirds flit from flower to flower. Thistlewit spins around. Wisps of her hair fly off like dandelion seeds. Knotgrass runs through the meadow traili her hand in the low grass. The grass grows tall in her wa Flittle and Thistlewit study a blue flower.
What color will you make the blue-bells this year? Flittle just looks at her.
Maleficent walks with Stefan. Her wings drag on the ground. They flap with irritation which causes her to fly up. Stefan grabs her.
YouвЂ™re drifting. He pulls her down to the ground.
TheyвЂ™re not happy when we walk. The Pixies see them approaching.
Maleficent. Those horns are perfect on you. Knotgrass steps on MaleficentвЂ™s trailing wing. She stumbles forward.
Leave her alone.
Go live with humans, halfling. Maleficent whirls around angrily. Her wings arch above her head.  15 16 11.
IвЂ™m a halfling too! Call me a halfling. Go ahead! They shrink back from her. She grabs Stefan.
Never mind them. They keep walking.
You killed your mother. Maleficent stops, stricken by the words. She looks up. Th Pixies hover overhead. They drop rocks and mud down on th Maleficent uses her wings to protect Stefan.
Stay here. She opens her wings. The Pixies scream and fly away. Maleficent goes after them.
Maleficent chases the Pixies like a hawk after sparrows. They scream.

Queen Ulla and the King sit on the bank Water Faeries perform aquatic acrobatics for them. They e cake and drink milk from flower teacups. The three Pixies fly toward them, screaming, with Malefic right behind them. The Pixies hide behind the King and Queen. But Maleficent keeps coming in a fury.
Stop right there! Ulla throws MAGIC at her. MaleficentвЂ™s wings buckle and falls. She hits the ground hard.
You see how devilish you are? I blame your father.  12.
She deserves to wear the horns.
Yes, she does. (to Maleficent) Admit you deserve them.
Why should I?
IвЂ™1l1 clip your wings if you donвЂ™t.
You wouldnвЂ™t!
Oh, but I would. Maleficent drops her head. She forces the words out bitterly.
I deserve to wear the horns.
For a hundred years.
For a hundred years.
Now get out of my sight! Maleficent opens her wings to fly.
Walk! She folds them and walks away, head bowed, wings trailing the ground.
Maleficent and Stefan sit in a high branch together.
I didnвЂ™t kill my mother. She died the night I was born.  18 13.
I know. Everyone does. WhoвЂ™s your father?
The Red Cap.
Him? No wonder youвЂ™re so... She gives him a sharp look.
What? Wild, dark, strange, dangerous.
Tall. But she knows perfectly well thatвЂ™s not what he meant. sees something off, dismayed.
Oh no, the Rowan.
The trunk of the tree has been split by lightning.
She wonвЂ™t live. Hold onto me. She puts her arm around his waist and leaps from the tree StefanвЂ™s thrilled as they fly to the ground.

Maleficent stands in front of the wounded tree. She closes her eyes. Sweat drips down her forehead as MAG flows from her to the tree. Stefan watches, fascinated an envious. Gradually, the split trunk mends itself. But the process took something essential from Maleficent. She collapses against the tree trunk.
One large horn, ringed and scarred, is rubbed vigorously against a tree trunk. It falls off. We hear a GASP of surprise. The other Horn is rubbed just vigorously. It falls off.
SheвЂ™s grown into a dark mysterious beauty. She rubs the places on her head where the horns had been. Stefan approaches. HeвЂ™s become a handsome YOUNG MAN.
There you are! I have news.
Queen Ulla dead.
How did you know? She nods at the horns on the ground.
Her spell is broken. She picks them up and throws them as far as she can.

The Fair People stand silently on the banks of the loch watching four black swans carry the funeral bier across t water and into the setting sun. The Pixies stand on the b with the others. Flittle and Thistlewit whisper.
Who will be Queen now?
No one knows. She had no heirs.
The Stone knows.
What stone?  21 22 15.
The QueenвЂ™s Stone. Anyone who wishes to be queen steps on the Stone. If she is false, it growls. If she is the one true Queen, it will it roar like a lion. Understand? Thistlewit studies her face.
You have green in your eyebrows. I never noticed that before. Knotgrass looks skyward.
Why do I waste my breath?
A faerie foot lands on the QueenвЂ™s Stone. It growls.
A female Faerie steps off quickly. Another female steps u The Stone GROWLS again. Kinloch shakes his head.
Maleficent leans down to look at her reflection. She pull her hair back where the horns used to be. She turns, admiring herself without them.
What are you doing?
(embarrassed) Nothing.
You were admiring yourself. She sees that heвЂ™s carrying a satchel.
Where are you going?  16.
To the human castle.
Why?
IвЂ™ve heard so much about it. I want to see for myself. A sudden feeling of dread overcomes her.
DonвЂ™t go there, Stefan.
YouвЂ™re not curious about humans?
Not at all.
You would be.
(defensively) What is that supposed to mean?
YouвЂ™re half human. ThereвЂ™s no shame in it.
IвЂ™m going then. She picks dead leaves from a tree branch as if she doesnв care.
Have a good time. He doesnвЂ™t go.
ItвЂ™s a long way if I have to walk...on foot.
How else are you going to walk? On your ears?  23 24 25 17.
Maleficent, will you take me to the human castle?
No.
Please? She sighs. She canвЂ™t say "no" to him.
Maleficent and Stefan fly entwined, arms tightly wrapped around each otherвЂ™s waists. StefanвЂ™s face is filled with the joy of flight, Malefic with the joy of being close to him.

They fly through a thick layer of cloud cover. A stone wall suddenly looms in front of them. Maleficent veers up, but their feet hit the edge and they fall onto hard unfamiliar surface. PULL BACK to reveal... EXT. KING HENRYвЂ™S CASTLE - THE TURRET 25 TheyвЂ™ve fallen onto the high battlements of the King He castle. Maleficent looks around uneasily. Stefan runs his hands over the stones.
Look at the way the stones fit together perfectly. ItвЂ™s ingenious.
ItвЂ™s unnatural. She touches the wall and shudders.
The stone is dead.  26 27 18.
She follows Stefan down the steps, grabbing the iron rail as she goes. She gasps and pulls her hand away.
DonвЂ™t touch the rail! ItвЂ™s iron! Stefan tentatively touches it.

I hardly feel anything, just a little sting. She looks at her palm. The flesh has been burned. He runs down the steps, touching the railing briefly as he goes. Maleficent tucks her hands in her robes. Her wings draw themselves up to avoid the iron railing as well.

They enter. The hall is crowded with humans and faeries. ThereвЂ™s food, drink, music and merry-making. Faeries perform aerial acrobatics. Others make rainbows and bring flowers to bloom for the children. The humans gasp and exclaim with delight. Maleficent is appalled by what she sees.

What is this? Stefan wanders off, intrigued. Maleficent looks up at the high arched ceiling, feeling trapped. Ominous iron filigree hangs all around. She moves through the hall, becoming more dismayed. The Pixies have all gro up as well. But theyвЂ™re still immature and idiotic. Fli speaks to a group of humans.
IвЂ™m in charge of Blue. ItвЂ™s a big responsibility.
Can you turn my dress blue? Flittle squeezes her eyes shut and touches her yellow dre It turns blue.  19.
Hmm. I like it better yellow. Turn it back, please.
I donвЂ™t make yellow. I only make blue.
Turn it back! Flustered, Flittle closes her eyes and reaches for the dress, but accidentally touches the womanвЂ™s hand. It promptly turns BLUE. The woman gasps.

Oh dear. ThatвЂ™s not what I...IвЂ™m terribly sorry... let me fix. She squeezes her eyes shut again and reaches out, brushin the womanвЂ™s face. It turns BLUE. The woman screams. Panicked, Flittle rushes away. Maleficent feels someone tugging at her wings. ItвЂ™s a HUMAN BOY. She jerks them The boy keeps touching her wings.
DonвЂ™t touch the wings.
YouвЂ™re mean! What magic can you do?
This. She waggles her fingers and walks away. The boy gasps. His fingers have grown together so he canв pull his hands apart. She walks up to Stefan whoвЂ™s chat with PRINCESS LEAH.
WeвЂ™re leaving now.
WhatвЂ™s wrong?
WhatвЂ™s wrong? Look around! This is an embarrassment.  20.
DonвЂ™t be silly. ItвЂ™s all in fun. Maleficent looks at her sharply.
Who are you?
IвЂ™m Princess Leah.
IвЂ™ve been accused of being a lot of things, but "silly" is not one of them. IsnвЂ™t that right, Stefan?
(nervously) Maybe we should talk over here. He tries to pull her away.
This may come as a surprise to you, Princess, but we donвЂ™t exist to serve the human rabble.
Maleficent! He pulls her away.
These people are our friends.
Friends? TheyвЂ™re using us! IвЂ™m leaving. Are you coming? She sees the somber look on his face.
Stefan?
IвЂ™m nothing there. My own father has disowned me. Her heart sinks as she realizes.
YouвЂ™re not coming back.  21.
I could have a future here.
You never intended to.
Maleficent... She turns her back on him abruptly and walks away.
She hurries down the hall, struggling against the tears. her distress, she canвЂ™t find her way out. She hears voi
ItвЂ™s a shame we lost the little Queen. She was so easy to manipulate. The words cut through her distress. She turns back to listen. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR What did she die of?
Old age. ItвЂ™s hard to believe she was over three hundred years old. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR What about the King?
He wonвЂ™t give us any trouble. She looks through the crack at the door.
The King is talking with his advisors.
Now that we have their trust, we can ask for anything we want. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR TheyвЂ™11 make us rich.  30
Even better. We can use them against our enemies. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR TheyвЂ™re too unpredictable for that. ThereвЂ™s no way to control them.
They have a weakness. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR WhatвЂ™s that?
Iron. At the door, Maleficent reacts with alarm.
I discovered it by accident. Then curiosity got the best of me and I tried it out on a few of them. KINGвЂ™S ADVISOR I would have liked to have seen that.

Some were burned. Some died. I was impressed with their stamina. TheyвЂ™11 make good soldiers for us. 22. The door slams open. Maleficent storms in with murder in eye. Her wings knock the advisors down. She slams Henry against the wall, looming over him like a dark avenging angel. He cowers fearfully.
If you touch another one of us, IвЂ™11 kill you! She releases him and storms out. The King falls to the floor, trembling and humiliated.
Maleficent returns to the hall. She looks for Stefan. still talking with Princess Leah. 30 HeвЂ™s  23.
Stefan!
I thought youвЂ™d gone.
We have to get our people out of here.
What are you talking about?
The King is planning to use iron against us. He looks at her skeptically.
Why are you doing this?
Did you hear what I said?
Why must you turn everyone you meet into an enemy? She backs away, shocked by his attitude. She sees guards come in. She hurries through the hall speaking quietly to the faeries.
Get out. Go back to the moors. YouвЂ™re not safe here. Some hurry away. Some stay. EveryoneвЂ™s confused. Henryв wife, QUEEN MARY stands with the Pixies.
Who is that?
ItвЂ™s just Maleficent. Never mind her.
She was born to cause trouble. The King runs into the Hall. He points at Maleficent.  31 32 24.
That one! The guards run toward her. She looks at Stefan. Their eyes meet briefly. Then she op her wings and flies out the window.
She flies, wings beating furiously. Tears stream down her face.
Kinloch yawns as more female faeries line up to try their luck with the Stone. It GROWLS every time. Maleficent lands on the mound.
Kinloch! Call our people back from the humanвЂ™s castle.
Why would I do that?
Their king is plotting against us.
ThatвЂ™s absurd. Henry is our friend.
Is he? He knows what iron can do. HeвЂ™s already used it against us.
I donвЂ™t believe you.
I heard him myself!
But youвЂ™re a known liar.
I have no reason to lie!  33 34 35 25.

Enough, Maleficent! YouвЂ™ve caused nothing but pain and heartbreak since the day you were born! He waves his hand in a circle. A STORM CLOUD appears above her head. Thunder cracks and sheвЂ™s pelted with hard, cold rain. She backs away with rain pouring down on her.
She flies furiously out of the moors and over the human farmlands. But she canвЂ™t get away from the storm cloud. flies until sheвЂ™s exhausted.
Maleficent lands on a long branch where she sits, gasping and furious. The private rain storm still pelts her.
A large RAVEN sits on the head of a SCARECROW. Two farmer throw rocks at him.
Get off! The raven leisurely preens its feathers as the rocks fly around it. Finally, a rock hits its target. The Raven squawks and flies to the tree.
The raven lands next to Maleficent. She glares at it. It glares back at her. They stew in silence. After a moment hops over on the branch so it wonвЂ™t get wet.
Crumbling walls are all thatвЂ™s left of an ancient castl swathed in thick moor mist. Maleficent stands before the ruins. The rain cloud is gone.  26.

I need your help. She hears guttural breathing and the scratching of claws. Something large approaches. The mist stirs. Maleficent waits. In a moment, a MAN walks out of the mist. He holds heavy staff. HeвЂ™s even taller than Maleficent and fierc handsome with dark malevolent eyes. He wears a worn RED C that color of blood. Maleficent looks very much like him. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Take the throne yourself.
You know why IвЂ™ve come. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER IвЂ™m always watching. YouвЂ™1l have to kill Kinloch.

I canвЂ™t do that. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Where does this conscience of yours come from? It doesnвЂ™t serve you. Your mother was burdened by it too. His dark eyes soften briefly to think of her. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER If you want to save your friends... although I donвЂ™t know why you would after all theyвЂ™ve done to you...

IвЂ™m the only one who knows what this human Henry is planning. I canвЂ™t stand by and let him use us like servants and slaves! MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Then act! Do what must be done. But you will be hated for it.
ThatвЂ™s nothing new. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER Then unleash yourself. Make me proud. He steps back. The mist swallows him up.  36 37 38 27.

Maleficent stands at the edge of the muddy bog. She close her eyes. Sweat drips down her forehead as MAGIC flows fr her to the bog. It begins to bubble and boil. Something large moves around in the mud. One by one, five CREATURES crawl from the bog. Her GUARDS are large, dour ugly with leathern wings, long arms that drag the ground feet turned backwards. As the last one crawls out, Maleficent sags from exhaustion.
Maleficent flies low to the ground followed by her guards She searches for something on the ground. She sees what sheвЂ™s looking for, scoops them up, and flies on.
The Faeries are still lined up to stand on the Stone. Oth entertain themselves with human objects: combs, brushes, mirrors, etc. Maleficent lands on the mound.
I want my turn on the Stone. She walks toward it with determination. The Faeries scram to get out of her way.
Stop right there! STOP! She steps up onto the QueenвЂ™s Stone. It SCREAMS in prot so loud the faeries cringe and hold their ears.

Step off! Step off! But Maleficent holds her ground. Her guards land on the Mound. The Stone still screams. Sh motions to Kinloch. They pull him off the throne and drag him away. Maleficent steps off the QueenвЂ™s Stone. Its stops screaming abruptly.  39 40 28. Maleficent plants herself firmly on the throne. Her guard take their places beside her. She takes out the horns she retrieved from the ground. She replaces them on her head sits back confidently. Queen Maleficent.
No one leaves the moors for the human world. Not now. Not ever.

The three Pixies fly toward the Moors carrying gifts from the humans. As they approach the FAERIE PATH, it LIGHTS O FIRE. FLAMES SHOOT skyward in front of the Pixies. They d back. After a moment the FLAMES dissipate.
What was that?

Sudden inexplicable flames from nowhere. They fly forward and SMACK into an INVISIBLE WALL. They f into the grass, dropping their loot. Thistlewit gets up a tries to fly forward again. She hits the invisible barrie and falls again. She tries yet again, and falls.
ItвЂ™s a binding spell.
We cannot pass. Thistlewit keeps flying at the barrier like an angry bee. They drag her away.
King Henry and Queen Mary look out over the banquet hall.
Where are all my Fair folk?
TheyвЂ™ve gone save for those three. The Pixies sit at the table eating milk and cake.  29.
You three. Approach. The Pixies come forward. He waits for them to bow. Queen Mary whispers helpfully.

Bow to your King. They look at each other...should we? Knotgrass shrugs. Th bow. Flittle feels someone staring at her. She looks up t see the WOMAN with the BLUE FACE glaring at her. Flittle steps behind Thistlewit to hide.
Can you spin straw into gold?
No.
Can you conjure up a storm?
No.
What can you do?
WeвЂ™re flower pixies.
We brighten your day with cheery blossums and blooms. They flit around, bringing all the wilted flowers and bouquets back to life. The King and Queen consult.
We need better ones.
(to the Pixies) Where are all your friends?
Someone put out a binding spell along the Path. None of us can pass through.  30.
Who would do such a thing?
It must be that tall bad-tempered one with the evil name...Malafisis.
Do you know her? They shake their heads vigorously.
SheвЂ™s no friend of ours. Knotgrass spots Stefan strolling with the princess. She points.
But he knows her very well.
You there... young man! Stefan looks over and indicates...me?
Approach. Stefan looks at the Princess. She smiles encouragingly. Stefan approaches King Henry. He bows.
What is your name, son?
Stefan.
I havenвЂ™t seen you before. Where are you from?
The moors.

Stefan deserves everything he gets.  88 89 90 61. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER An eye for an eye. Tooth for a tooth.
Exactly. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER IвЂ™m proud of you. ItвЂ™s just the sort of thing I would have done. He walks away into the mist. Maleficent thinks about that oddly unsettled.
INT. KING STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE 88 The Captain takes off his heavy helmet. HeвЂ™s dusty and exhausted. Stefan holds up a hand.
DonвЂ™t speak unless the words are: "Maleficent is dead". The Captain drops his head and trudges out.
A childвЂ™s screams and laughter fills the air. The Pixie chase THREE YEAR-OLD Aurora across a meadow.
Maleficent and Diaval watch from a high tree across a ste gully beyond them.
Knotgrass stumbles and falls. ThereвЂ™s a Pixie pileup.
Get off!
IвЂ™ve lost my slipper!  62.
YouвЂ™re stepping on my hair. As they pinch and squeal, toddler Aurora runs on. ON THE BABY - MALEFICENTвЂ™S POV The unsupervised toddler runs straight toward the steep drop-off of the gully.
The little beastie is going to fall into that ravine.
The Pixies havenвЂ™t even noticed that Aurora is gone.
Do they even know sheвЂ™s gone?
He flies off to alert them.
SheвЂ™s coming closer to the drop-off.
SheвЂ™s getting nervous.
Go back. YouвЂ™re going to fall.
SheвЂ™s still not slowing. She runs right to the edge of drop-off.
Go back!
She runs right off the steep edge. But she doesnвЂ™t fall hangs in midair, her chubby legs still running in place.  91 92 63.
She holds out the staff, magically keeping the baby in th air.
The baby laughs gleefully.
She smiles despite herself. She spins the staff.
The baby spins upside down and back around, then keeps running in midair back to the cliff. Her little feet land firm ground and she runs back the way she came.
She drops the staff and shakes her head.
Diaval flies around the PixiesвЂ™ heads trying to get the attention. They swat at him.
Go away! Diaval snatches at ThistlewitвЂ™s hair.
DonвЂ™t touch the hair! Diaval hears laughter. He sees the toddler coming back toward the Pixies. She runs to them. They pick her up.
There you are!
Maleficent sits on her throne. Diaval is perched on her shoulder. He preens his feathers. She draws absently in t dirt with her staff. TheyвЂ™re both thinking of Aurora.  93 94 95 64.
I wonder what the little beastie is up to? They both leap up a little too eagerly.

The Pixies are having a picnic. AURORA is 5 years old now Maleficent and Diaval observe from the forest shadows. An autumn downpour suddenly drenches the Pixies. They scream and run into the house forgetting all about Aurora. Aurora follows them back to the cottage. But theyвЂ™ve already closed the door. She pounds on it, no one answers. She cries. Still no one comes. Maleficent and Diaval look at each other. Aurora goes aro the cottage, looking for a way in, sobbing and getting drenched. Maleficent throws up her hands with disgust. She lifts her STAFF. A GALE FORCE WIND angrily blows the front door off its hinges.
The Pixies stare at the broken-down door. Aurora walks in drenched and crying.
There you are.

Aurora is 7. She gathers berries. She sits down under a t to eat a few. In a moment, her eyes close and she drifts off. A SNAKE crawls towards her from the bushes. It gets closer. Suddenly a tall HORNED SHADOW looms over the sleeping gir MaleficentвЂ™s staff lifts the SNAKE and tosses it away.
She stands over the sleeping child.  96 97 98 99 65. Her expression softens briefly. Then she shakes her head if admonishing herself for having a weak moment. She glan up at Diaval in the tree.
What? He turns his head away as if he saw nothing.
Aurora is now 10 years old. She plays sword fight with an invisible friend near a rushing river.
Yah! Yah! Have at you! Her game takes her to the river. She crosses on the stepp stones, but loses her balance and falls into the river.

The current is strong. SheвЂ™s swept downstream. She goes under, comes up, gasping, grabs for tree roots, anything. She goes under again. Her hand reaches up and finds... MaleficentвЂ™s STAFF. She grabs onto it with both hands a sheвЂ™s pulled onto the bank.
She lays face-down on the bank, not moving. MaleficentвЂ™ HORNED SHADOW leans over her to see if sheвЂ™s breathing. Aurora gasps. MaleficentвЂ™s shadow retreats.
EXT. ON AURORA AND MALEFICENTвЂ™S SHADOW - DAY 99 15 year old, AURORA runs toward the faerie path and the moors beyond. MaleficentвЂ™s shadow with Diaval on her shoulder tracks her as she goes.
Come back, Aurora!  66. Aurora turns around. MaleficentвЂ™s shadow quickly blends with the shadow of a rock. Aurora is very pretty with tin delicate features. The Pixies beckon her from the cottage
DonвЂ™t go near the moors!
Why canвЂ™t I?
Because we said so.
You always say that.

head_text.subj: ON MALEFICENT AND DIAVAL, THE MAN

text: They sit on the rock, watching her go inside.
TheyвЂ™re going about this all wrong. If they tell her "no", thatвЂ™s exactly what sheвЂ™1l do.
May I ask you a question?
That depends.
When are you planning to undo your curse?
Who said I was planning to undo it?
Mistress.
I hate the little beastie.
You hate Stefan! May I speak freely?
You canвЂ™t seem to help yourself.  100 67.
YouвЂ™re not as bad as you think you are. Annoyed, she waves her hand to transform him.
Be a bird! But this time, he catches her hand and holds it.
Every time you donвЂ™t like what I have to say you transform me back into a bird.
I thought you liked being a bird. He looks at her with more feelings than he can share.

Not as much as I used to. Maleficent looks away. She waves her hand abruptly and transforms him. INT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - THE GREAT HALL - DAY 100 King Stefan has aged beyond his years. Children run and scream. Leah is with child again.
Your children are driving me mad!
TheyвЂ™re your children too. The Captain approaches. He bows and removes his helmet. H gone grey.
Well? The Captain shakes his head.
I donвЂ™t want to hear that!

He didnвЂ™t say anything. Let the man speak.  STEFANвЂ™S CAPTAIN Sire. My men and I have searched the length and breadth of the land, kingdom to kingdom, shore to shore and back again. We have endured rainstorms, blizzards, gale force winds, scorching heat and the attack of countless wild creatures. But Maleficent is not to be found. I am sorry I have failed you.
YouвЂ™re dismissed! The Captain trudges off, secretly relieved.
Why are you still looking for that witch?
SheвЂ™s not a witch.
She may be dead.
SheвЂ™s not dead. I would know if she were. Leah looks at her husband curiously.
Is there something you havenвЂ™t told me?
No.
You have to forget about Maleficent.
Aurora will be returned to_us soon and this unpleasantness will be behind us.
What is your mother doing? Old Queen Mary sits by the window at a spinning wheel. 68.  101 69.
Spinning, Stefan. She enjoys the work.
I had all the spinning wheels destroyed.
ItвЂ™s been years. IвЂ™m certain Maleficent has forgotten all about that silly insult at the christening.

She has not forgotten. Maleficent cannot be underestimated. We have to remain diligent, especially now. I want that spinning wheel burned. Leah looks at her husband, thinking of all the other men might have married.
Maleficent sits on her throne surrounded by the guards. Diaval sits on her shoulder. Kinloch and some faeries approach.
Your Majesty. SheвЂ™s instantly defensive.
What is it? DonвЂ™t you like the way I govern? AllвЂ™s well in the moors, is it not?
Yes.
Then what seems to be the problem?
WeвЂ™re not free to go to the human world.  102 103 70.
Ah well, thatвЂ™s a price we all must learn to live with. Now go away before I become unpleasant.
(under his breath) Become? Maleficent heard that. She levels her dark gaze on him.

This is not unpleasant. Do you want to see what unpleasant looks like? MaleficentвЂ™s face changes. Her darkest nature comes to the surface. Anger and bitterness twist her face so that she does look truly frightening. White Fire erupts all around her. Kinloch an faeries rush away. Maleficent strokes Diaval.
He made me do that. I didnвЂ™t enjoy it at all.
Maleficent stands outside the cottage.
She can see Aurora in her nightgown getting ready for bed
She looks torn as if battling dark forces within. She tur abruptly and walks away. INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 103 She lies in her bed. The Pixies open the door.
Is she asleep yet? She closes her eyes, pretending. They close the door.  104 105

The Pixies take off their tattered, peasant sweaters like too-tight brassieres and release their wings, stretching them out. INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 105 She opens her eyes again and sits up. She looks out the window.
The mist rises up across the hills in the distance. The moors seem to beckon her.
Aurora looks back at the kitchen, then opens the window a slips out into the night.
Aurora runs across the faerie path and into the moors, leaping with mischievous joy.
Aurora follows the faerie path. She hear the FAERIE VOICE She stops to listen.
She sees the Fair Folk camouflaged in the flowers, trees, streams and ponds.
I knew you were here.

Maleficent has returned. She approaches the cottage soundlessly. She sees AuroraвЂ™s window, open now. She fr and looks inside. ON AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - HER POV The bed is empty. AuroraвЂ™s nowhere in sight.
Worried, Maleficent moves around to the kitchen window.
The Pixies fly around the kitchen, bashing into each othe knocking things over and laughing hysterically. Milk jugs lay spilt on the table. Butterflies abound.
She looks around for Aurora in a panic. Diaval flies towa her. She waves her hand to transform him.
Now a man! He transforms before he lands. He hits the ground hard.
Can you wait until IвЂ™ve landed?
Have you seen Aurora?
I spotted her in the moors.
Then what are you doing here? You shouldnвЂ™t have left her alone! She canвЂ™t wander around out there by herself!
I thought you hated her. She hurries away. He looks down at his human body.
DonвЂ™t leave me like this.
She waves an impatient hand over her head.
Be a bird. In a moment, Diaval strafes her head, just a little too close.  110 73.
Stay with her!

The full moon shines down on Aurora who stands at the bot of the tree looking up at the Elves. They screech at her. SheвЂ™s not afraid of them. Diaval circles overhead and l in a nearby tree to keep watch.

Aurora approaches the peat bog and watches the Wallerbogs drool and dribble. ON MALEFICENTвЂ™S MOON-SHADOW - AURORAвЂ™S POV MaleficentвЂ™s shadow looms over her suddenly. ItвЂ™s dis and clear in the moonlight. Aurora smiles to see it.
I know youвЂ™re there. The shadow retreats suddenly. She turns around.
DonвЂ™t be afraid. MaleficentвЂ™s amused voice answers from behind the rocks
IвЂ™m not afraid.
Then come out.
YouвЂ™1l1 be startled.
I wonвЂ™t. Come out. Maleficent emerges. Aurora smiles, not the least surprise by her appearance.
Hello, Faerie Godmother. Maleficent tries not to laugh.  She turns again. 74.
You think IвЂ™m youвЂ™re Faerie Godmother?
Who else would you be? YouвЂ™ve been watching over me my whole life.
Somebody had to.
IвЂ™ve always known about you...ever since I was a little girl. around so that MaleficentвЂ™s shadow falls over her

You see? ThatвЂ™s the shadow IвЂ™ve been seeing ever since I was small. Wherever I went that shadow was always with me. But donвЂ™t you have a bird? In the shadow, Diaval lands on MaleficentвЂ™s shoulder.
This is Diaval. Aurora turns and reaches up to pet him. He preens. WILD ELVISH WOMEN and WEB-FOOTED SPRITES with sharp teeth watc from the thick tangled roots of trees. Aurora sees them.
Who are they? Maleficent steps between them.
Not everyone you meet in the moors is benevolent. You must never come out here alone.
IвЂ™m not afraid.
ThatвЂ™s enough for one night.
But... Maleficent waves her hand in front of her eyes.  75.
Sleep. Aurora goes limp. Maleficent catches her by lifting her hands. Aurora floats in the air.

A prone, sleeping Aurora drifts back toward the cottage. Diaval flies ahead. Maleficent walks behind. 112 INT. THE COTTAGE - AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 112 Maleficent lowers her back into her bed. She pulls the covers up, then she waves her hands over he
My curse is undone. You are free to live a long and happy life. And you will never tell your aunts about me. Good night, beastie.
The kitchen is a disaster. Flittle climbs up on a stack o chairs to get a vase. Thistlewit and Knotgrass sit at the table. Thistlewit has her head in her hands.
I drank too much milk. Why did you let me do that?
WhereвЂ™s your kerchief?
I lost it. Knotgrass tries to put a kerchief on Thistlewit who pushe her away. Flittle reaches for the vase. She loses her balance and falls to the floor.
Ah! That wouldnвЂ™t have happened if I could use my wings.
Shh! SheвЂ™11 be up soon.  76.
I want to fly again!
I want to go back to the castle!

So do I! Do you think I like being trapped in this horrid little cottage with you two imbeciles? They all start to cry. Aurora walks in to find her aunts bawling. She shakes her head as if this is nothing new.
There. There. What happened this time?
I fell and hurt myself. She helps Flittle up.
Poor old thing. Wait. I have a question. How old are you? YouвЂ™ve looked the same my whole life. And another thing, why do we have spring flowers even in winter? She waves at the butterflies.
And where are all these butterflies coming from? No one ventures an answer.
So, did you sleep well?
And why do you always ignore my questions! They putter around the kitchen.
Would you like breakfast, Cabbage?
She doesnвЂ™t want cabbage for breakfast. Who eats cabbage for breakfast?  77.
I didnвЂ™t say, do you want cabbage for breakfast? I said...do you want breakfast, Cabbage? Aurora shakes her head and looks skyward... Why me ?
Aurora plays in the peat bog with the Wallerbogs. Mud flies. She laughs hysterically. Maleficent and Diaval share their amusement.
Aurora and Maleficent sit together on a rock overlooking moors. They watch Diaval soar high on the wind above.
And heвЂ™s also a man?
If I want him to be. Aurora watches Heather Faeries fly over the meadows below
Do all of the Fair People have wings?
Most do.
Then why donвЂ™t you? The old anger suddenly rises up in Maleficent.
I said...most do! AuroraвЂ™s taken aback.
Sorry I asked. Maleficent softens.  116 78.
I had wings once.
What happened to them?
They were stolen from me. ThatвЂ™s all IвЂ™1l say about it.
What color were they?
Black. And thatвЂ™s enough about them. Aurora waits a minute.
How big were they?
Aurora. Aurora goes quiet. Maleficent looks off, remembering.

So big they dragged behind me when I walked. And they were strong. They could carry me above the clouds and straight into the headwinds. They never faltered. Not once. I could trust them. Aurora can see her loss and regret. She takes her hand. Maleficent looks down at StefanвЂ™s childвЂ™s hand in her Her heart freezes. She pulls it away.
Time to go back.
They walk back together across the misty hills. Diaval fl above.
I have a confession to make. + eH O*  79.
Do you?
All day long, all I can think about is coming back to the moors. I love it here. It feels like home to me.
This is not your home. Aurora walks a little ahead of her.

Then where is it? And donвЂ™t tell me itвЂ™s that cottage with my aunts. She steps onto the edge of a WHITE STONE that juts up fro the ground. As her foot lands briefly on it... it ROARS, shaking the ground. Aurora jumps off quickly.
What was that? Maleficent looks around, alarmed.

Come back. Quickly! Aurora hurries back toward her and steps on the stone aga It ROARS. Aurora runs to her side. Maleficent and Diaval look at the white stone. ON THE QUEENвЂ™S STONE ItвЂ™s tilted and half-buried in sod and grass.
So thatвЂ™s where it fell. Aurora approaches.
What is it? Maleficent looks from the QueenвЂ™s Stone to Aurora...and again with shock and realization.
WhatвЂ™s wrong?  117 80.
Nothing. Go to sleep. She waves her hand in front of her eyes. Aurora goes limp. Maleficent keeps her aloft as she sleep She looks at Diaval.

How is it possible? She closes her eyes and holds her staff out over the Ston She slowly raises it out of the ground and sets it uprigh on top of the ground. She brushes the dirt away. Then she slowly lowers the prone, sleeping Aurora onto th QueenвЂ™s Stone. SheвЂ™s so small she fits on it perfectl As her body settles down, the STONE PURRS, exactly the wa it did when Ulla stood on it years earlier. Maleficent lo at Diaval with disbelief.
Maleficent stands before the ruins. In a moment, her fath appears. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER This is an interesting twist of fate.
If Aurora is the true Queen, then maybe I should step down. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER YouвЂ™d give up your throne? To the child of your sworn enemy no less? WhatвЂ™s gotten into you?
It was never mine. I took it by force. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER You did what had to be done at the time. Forget about the Stone. Bury it. No one will ever know.  118 81.
I will know. MALEFICENTвЂ™S FATHER ThereвЂ™s that conscience again. I think the raven is right about you. He seems disappointed as he walks back into the ruins.
Maleficent walks, practicing what sheвЂ™s going to say.

ThereвЂ™s something you need to know....this is going to come as a big shock...no...sit down... She hears AuroraвЂ™s laughter. She listens. ThereвЂ™s ano unfamiliar voice. A YOUNG MANвЂ™S voice. The words are no distinct. Maleficent peers through the foliage.
Aurora is talking to a handsome young man who holds a whi horse.
I'd better be on my way. He gets on the horse.
WhatвЂ™s your name?
Phillip. Maybe IвЂ™11 be lucky enough to see you again.
Then I would be lucky too.
Where do you live? She opens her arms.
Here.  82.
Then IвЂ™1l1 see you here! He rides off. Aurora watches him go with a secret smile. MaleficentвЂ™s MOON-SHADOW looms over her suddenly.
And who was that?
No one.
(angrily) I saw you talking to a man... Who was it ? AuroraвЂ™s surprised by her anger.
Oh, his name was Phillip... HeвЂ™d lost his way.
You are not to talk to strangers.
You sound just like my aunts.
I am not like your aunts!
Then why are you acting like them?
IвЂ™m trying to keep you safe!
IвЂ™m almost sixteen! I can take care of myself! She turns and runs off. Maleficent doesnвЂ™t go after her
Fine! Go on! Get yourself out of your own mess. IвЂ™ve had enough if it! She steams for a moment, then looks over at Diaval ina nearby tree.  119 120 121 83.
Well, go after her

Aurora sits down on a rock to sulk. A LONG GREEN ARM emer from the water and reaches toward her. Diaval arrives jus as the GREEN WATER WOMAN grabs AuroraвЂ™s ankle. The Gree Woman pulls Aurora toward the water. Diaval dives at her.
Awk! Awk!
She hears his cry. She listens.
No! Let me go! Maleficent runs.
Aurora kicks at the Green Woman as she pulls her toward t water.
Let go!
She runs. Her robes fly behind like wings.
The Green Woman has Aurora in the water. Diaval dives at her. Aurora SCREAMS as the cold water closes over her hea

The Green Woman drags her down into the dark depths. Diav dives down into the water after them. He stabs at the Green Woman with his beak. Aurora struggl to get out of her grasp. Suddenly, Maleficent plunges into the water. She pulls Aurora out of the Green WomanвЂ™s grip.  122 123 84. Aurora swims to the surface as Maleficent, the Green Woma and Diaval battle underwater.
Coughing and gasping, Aurora drags herself out of the pon She runs.
The battle continues until the Green Woman floats away lifelessly. Maleficent kicks to the surface.
She explodes out of the water, gasping for air. She climbs onto the bank and sees the ravenвЂ™s body floa in the water. She picks him up and lays him on the bank. doesnвЂ™t move.
Diaval? She waves his hands over him frantically.
Now a man! Diaval transforms. But heвЂ™s still not breathing.
Diaval? Diaval! She pounds on his chest. He gasps suddenly, and gulps for air. Maleficent leans back, more relieved than she ever thought sheвЂ™d be. Diaval sits up.
I thought IвЂ™d lost you. But this is too revealing.
Then what would I do for wings? Diaval covers his disappointment at her cavalier attitude He looks around.
WhereвЂ™s Aurora? INT. THE COTTAGE - AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM 124 Aurora sleeps in her bed. Maleficent stands over her.

Aurora? She doesnвЂ™t stir. Maleficent pulls the covers over her gently and goes out. Diaval sits in the window for a moment before he flies aw After theyвЂ™ve gone, Aurora opens her eyes. INT. THE COTTAGE - AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - DAY 125 The Pixies burst into her bedroom, waking her abruptly.
Happy birthday, Cabbage!
WeвЂ™re going on a lovely journey today. Aurora looks out the window at the moors.
I donвЂ™t want to go on a journey.
You donвЂ™t have a choice. Get her dressed. They throw clothes at her.
The Pixies are in the wagon. Aurora is reluctant. She loo out at the moors.
IвЂ™m not going.
ThereвЂ™s someone I need to talk to.
Who? You donвЂ™t know anyone.
IвЂ™m not going. Knotgrass finally loses it.
Sixteen years. WeвЂ™ve looked after you out here in the middle of nowhere in that broken down raggedy hovel for sixteen years!
WeвЂ™ve put up with your whining and crying and puking...
And all your stupid questions that we donвЂ™t know the answers to!

WeвЂ™ve done our job. And now weвЂ™re giving you back. Get in the wagon! They pull her into the wagon forcefully and jam her in between them. Knotgrass whips the horse. Aurora looks bac at the moors as they drive off.
EXT. KING STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - EVENING 127 The Pixies wagon approaches the castle at a dead run.
The hall is being set up for AuroraвЂ™s arrival the next Servants set up tables. Children run through. Leah holds a baby. The Pixies enter with Aurora. SheвЂ™s utterly bewildered.
WeвЂ™re back!  87.
What are you doing here? You are not to arrive until tomorrow.
Today is her sixteenth birthday.

I told you to bring her the day after her birthday. Aurora looks around at the heavy oppressive room...the ir filigree above. She puts her hand on the stone wall and pulls it back quickly. She shudders.
Well, itвЂ™s been a long time. How can we be expected to remember?
I should have known not to trust Flower Pixies! WhereвЂ™s the child? He looks right past Aurora. They push her toward him.
Here.
This?
Aurora, meet your mother and father. Aurora is so shocked she canвЂ™t speak. Leah hands her ba a nursemaid and opens her arms to Aurora.
Come over here and let me have a look at you. She backs up a step.
What are we going to do with her? The idiot Pixies have brought her back a day too soon. Flittle folds her arms.  129 88.
Well, weвЂ™re not taking her back.
I canвЂ™t stay anyway. She rubs the tip of her index finger absently.
WeвЂ™1l have to lock you in a safe place for the night.
Why?
I know itвЂ™s a terrible homecoming, dear. But your fatherвЂ™s worried about some old curse.
I have to go back to the moors.
That life is over. Stefan pulls her away. Flittle sees the lady with the Blu Face who has grown much older. She points at Flittle.
You ruined my life! Flittle grabs Knotgrass urgently.
IвЂ™ve changed my mind. I want to go back to the horrid little cottage.
Stefan ushers Aurora firmly down the hall.
Let me go back. Please. This is a mistake.
The whining and begging may have softened the Pixies, but not me. He puts her in a room.  130 131 132 133 89.
Welcome home. WeвЂ™1l talk in the morning when this is all over. He closes the door and locks it.
Shutters bang on the windows. Diaval lands on the sill an looks in.
Awk! Awk! Maleficent emerges from the shadows and goes inside.

She walks though the messy abandoned cottage. The flowers are wilted without the Pixies presence there. One stray butterfly has been left behind. She goes into AuroraвЂ™s bedroom. INT. AURORAвЂ™S BEDROOM - NIGHT 132 But the bed is empty. Alarm floods her face.
Diaval! He flies in the window.

Those idiots have taken her! Fly to StefanвЂ™s castle! I have no wings! Fly! INT. STEFANвЂ™S CASTLE - THE KITCHEN - NIGHT 133 The Pixies gorge themselves on milk and pastries while th servants bustle around them. Diaval lands in the window.
Even if we did bring her back too soon, weвЂ™ve still foiled MaleficentвЂ™s curse.  90.
She wonвЂ™t die when she pricks her finger. Thanks to our quick thinking.
My quick thinking. I was the one who said: "It will not be death that claims her only sleep." Diaval twists his head curiously.
I gave that idea to you.
No, you didnвЂ™t.
Yes, I did.
And I thought up the part about "true loveвЂ™s kiss".
No, you didnвЂ™t.
Yes, she did.
It was my spell! I said "She can only be woken by true loveвЂ™s kiss"!
We gave it all to you.

No, you didnвЂ™t! Diaval has heard enough. He flies away. 134 INT. AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT 134 The moon shines on Aurora who rubs the tip of her index finger again. She goes to the window and looks out. Diava lands on the sill.
Diaval? Is that you?  135 136 137 91.
Awk! He flies off.
Where are you going? She rubs her finger again.
Stefan paces nervously as he talks to his men. The small to AuroraвЂ™s room sits on a table.

Maleficent will come at midnight to watch her curse unfold. The moment she appears, use the iron. Do not hesitate. Diaval lands on the table. Stefan sees him. He realizes and makes a grab for him. Diaval evades him a snatches the key in his beak.

Catch that bird! Diaval flies around with the key in his beak evading the men. He flies out of the room. Diaval flies down the hall with StefanвЂ™s men behind. He startles the oncoming serv and knocks over tables and chairs. INT. AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT 136 She hears a commotion in the hall. A key rattles in the door. EXT. THE HALL - ON AURORAвЂ™S DOOR 137 Diaval flutters as he tries to fit the key in the lock wi his beak. StefanвЂ™s men run toward him. He finally manages to fit it in. The men throw objects. H evades them, then turns the key with his beak.  138 139 140 141 92. INT. AURORAвЂ™S ROOM - NIGHT 138 She hears the lock turn and turns the knob. The door opens. Outside, the guards and servants scream and throw things the raven who flaps around to distract them. Aurora slips away unseen.
Maleficent runs as fast as her feet will take her. She lo skyward, wishing desperately for wings.
Stefan looks in the open door to AuroraвЂ™s empty room.
Search the castle for the princess Aurora.
Diaval flies toward Maleficent. He swoops down. She waves her hand.
Now a man. He hits the ground running transformed into a MAN. Maleficent tosses him a bag of clothes.
